backend/main.mo: Main Motoko actor for the ICP backend, defining user profiles, tests, questions, and test results with CRUD operations, access control via admin/user permissions, and blob storage mixins.
feature_evidence.json: Feature evidence report documenting two implemented features in TestPage.tsx: pre-fetching all question images on test load and optimizing the test submission flow to minimize latency.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: JSON document containing short summaries of each frontend source file, describing their purpose, styling approach, and key behaviors across pages, hooks, and components.
frontend/index.css: Base Tailwind CSS file defining OKLCH-based CSS custom properties for light and dark mode color tokens including background, foreground, card, sidebar, and chart colors.
frontend/index.html: Minimal HTML entry point for the React app, setting the page title to 'Concept Delta' and mounting the app at the `#root` div via `src/main.tsx`.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Root React component that sets up TanStack Router with all application routes and conditionally renders the ProfileSetupModal for first-time authenticated users.
frontend/src/components/admin/QuestionGa: Admin panel component for uploading question images with a correct-answer selector and displaying/deleting existing questions, with upload progress tracking.
frontend/src/components/admin/ResultsTab: Admin tab that fetches and displays a table of all student test results, showing marks, score, percentage, and date by cross-referencing test and user data.
frontend/src/components/admin/TestBuilde: Admin form for creating new tests by specifying a name, duration, marks configuration, and selecting questions from the existing question bank.
frontend/src/components/admin/TestManage: Admin table listing all tests with their status and a toggle switch to publish or unpublish each test via a mutation hook.
frontend/src/components/admin/UsersTab.t: Admin tab component that fetches and displays all registered users in a table with columns for name, principal, class, and contact number, with loading skeletons and an empty state.
frontend/src/components/AdminRoute.tsx: Route guard component that restricts access to admin-only pages, redirecting unauthenticated users to `/`, non-admins to `/dashboard`, and admins who have already visited the admin panel back to `/dashboard` with a toast notification.
frontend/src/components/Navbar.tsx: Sticky responsive navbar with Internet Identity login/logout buttons, conditional nav links based on auth and admin status, and a mobile hamburger menu.
frontend/src/components/ProfileSetupModa: A modal dialog that collects new user profile information (name, class, contact number), validates inputs, and saves the profile via a mutation hook before navigating to the dashboard.
frontend/src/components/ProtectedRoute.t: A route guard component that redirects unauthenticated users to the home page and shows a loading spinner while the Internet Identity auth state is initializing.
frontend/src/components/TestCard.tsx: Displays a summary card for a single test showing its name, duration, and question count, with a button that navigates to the test-taking page.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: Custom hook that creates and caches an authenticated or anonymous ICP backend actor using React Query, reinitializing and invalidating dependent queries whenever the identity changes.
frontend/src/hooks/useGetCallerUserProfi: Custom hook that fetches the currently authenticated user's profile from the backend actor, gating the query on actor readiness and authentication state.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Provides an InternetIdentityProvider and useInternetIdentity hook for managing Internet Identity authentication, including login, logout, and persisted identity state via AuthClient.
frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts: Centralizes all React Query hooks for the app, covering user profiles, published tests, test submission, results, and admin operations like managing questions and users.
frontend/src/hooks/useTestTimer.ts: Custom hook that implements a countdown timer for a given duration in minutes, exposing remaining time, formatted string, percentage, and an expiry callback.
frontend/src/index.css: Global stylesheet that imports Google Fonts, configures Tailwind CSS with custom CSS variables for light/dark themes, and defines utility classes for gradients and animations.
frontend/src/main.tsx: Application entry point that renders the React app wrapped with QueryClientProvider and InternetIdentityProvider.
frontend/src/pages/AdminPage.tsx: Admin page component with a tabbed interface for managing questions, tests, users, and results, accessible only to users with admin privileges.
frontend/src/pages/DashboardPage.tsx: Displays the student dashboard with a welcome banner, stats bar (available tests, total questions, total duration), and a grid of published test cards with loading skeletons.
frontend/src/pages/HomePage.tsx: Marketing landing page for the MHT-CET mock test platform, featuring a hero section, feature highlights, benefits list, and navigation CTAs for Telegram and YouTube.
frontend/src/pages/TestPage.tsx: Interactive test-taking page that renders questions with answer options, tracks a countdown timer, and shows a confirmation dialog before submitting results.
frontend/src/pages/TestResultPage.tsx: Displays the result of a completed test, showing score, percentage, and a breakdown of correct, wrong, and skipped answers fetched from the user's latest result.
frontend/src/utils/urlParams.ts: Utility module providing functions to read, persist, and clear URL parameters from both query strings and hash-based routes, with sessionStorage fallback support.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Tailwind CSS configuration defining custom navy color palette, Inter/Space Grotesk fonts, CSS variable-based semantic colors, custom shadows, and animation keyframes.
project_state.json: Tracks the overall project state (version 29) for 'Concept Delta', a responsive MHT-CET test series website, including architectural notes, known issues, and a list of existing features with their IDs and requirements.
